Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2008 05:44PM carpediempenny wrote: Hi ladies, I ended up in the ER Monday night with a blood clot in my left jugular vein down my shoulder in to my arm. How scarey is that. It is from my port (never has worked from the get go) The good that came out of that was I got to see my oncologist two days early and they left me have my LAST chemo treatmen yesterday. How cool is that? NO more chemo. sweet. Hy hairless days are numbered. I just have to get through the last 10 days of SE's for me and watch my blood while I am on blood thinners. I have to plan my surgery now but I think I am going for the double instead of a lumpectomy. I sure don't want to go through this again. I am sorry to hear some of you are going through lympedema. I am concerned about that as well since they had to use the vein in my right arm and that was the SNB arm but they couldn't use the left where the port is because of the clot. Are we having fun yet? Take care ladies and sleep well tonight. Penny
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: May 3, 2008 12:51AM carpediempenny wrote: HI ladies, I haven't posted here in a while, life has been crazy. I finished chemo the end of Jan, had my bilateral with free tram flap done March 22nd and now in radiation (#5 of 25 today) I am healing from surgery but it takes a while. I feel good in the morning and then evenings get me. I am disappointed in the growth of my hair on my head. It seems to be growing very slow. I lost all eyebrows and eyelashes after last chemo and even the peach fuzz on my face fell out. Now the hair is growing so fast every where but my head. I stopped wearing all head gear this past Monday, it was just to uncomfortable. I decided it didn't matter what others thought, I didn't ask for this cancer. It has been nice catching up on how everyone is doing. Good to know things are looking up. Take care and have a wonderful weekend! Penny
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: May 24, 2008 03:03AM - edited May 24, 2008 03:04AM by carpediempenny Hi Sue, where in CO are you going? I live in Denver. We had the tornadoes yesterday. My hair is straight and still only about half inch long. It won't lay down either, it sticks straight up. I tried to goop it down but that didn't even put a dent in it. Guess I need super glue. Not sure what is going to happen with it, strange for sure. Still no eyelashes to speak of either. I hope everyone has a great Memorial weekend. Penny

Posts.Content: Nov 1, 2007 01:11AM carpediempenny wrote: I must be weird, I am continuing to work during my treatments. I can work from home on the bad days so that helps. Welcome Lori! Good luck on your 2nd this Friday. Ladies, how long after first dx was your first treatment? I am on day 12 after first treatment and waiting to see when the hair starts to go. My onc says I will without a doubt lose my hair, so I cut it off to be proactive instead of reactive. I figured I could handle it better this way. Karen, I also didn't realize how dark my hair was until cutting it off. wow My round 2 is on the 9th but then I will have 4 more after that. I know a little more this time around so that will help. I hope it isn't worse, fingers crossed anyway.

Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2008 03:33AM carpediempenny wrote: Hi Lori, Thanks for your thoughts about me. I appreciate it. I am so thrilled to be done with chemo and on meds for the blood clot that was in my jugular vein. I am starting to feel somewhat normal again. Being on so many meds is draining. I am looking at the next phase for me and that is surgery. I have decided on a bilateral mastectomy even tho I only have the tumor in the right breast. I really don't want to go through all this again so I am going to be proactive. My peace of mind means a lot. I really don't know what to expect. My daughter wants to come help me out when I get home from the hospital so that will be nice. I don't look forward to the pain but I do look forward to the benefits of a flat tummy and clean new breasts cancer free. I hope everyone has a bright and sunny day. Take care and remember we are strong and beautiful women who can handle what is thrown our way. We will survive! Penny

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2007 05:39AM carpediempenny wrote: My onc told me not to take Coq10, echinacea, st john's wort, vitamin A and some vitamin B's. I am really scared to take something that will hinder my chemo treatments. Maybe my onc said that because I am a triple neg. I had to tell my son that I wouldn't be able to watch my grandkids for a few months. I sure don't want to have tx postponed due to low counts. I miss them but our health comes first now. I am being given neulasta after each tx too so that will help. Expensive little buggers.

Posts.Content: Nov 1, 2007 06:19AM carpediempenny wrote: I was dx on 9/26, went through all the tests, mammogram/ultrasound, Biopsy, MRI, PET/CT scan, echocardiogram, blood work done, surgery on 10/08 for SNB and port insertion and then chemo on 10/19. Along with having 2 periods and the flu during this time frame as well. My body was rebelling having been poked and prodded. I was fortunate that every time I called for an appointment they just had a cancellation. I was meant to start chemo on 10/19. This was a significant date for me 28 years ago exactly on Friday Oct. 19th. Take care all and Happy Halloween!!! Penny

Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2007 01:22AM carpediempenny wrote: I got my flu shot b4 my first tx. My onc said it would be a good idea. I had my 2nd tx on Friday and can't sleep at night. I sleep maybe 4 hours and then toss and turn. I don't really feel good today. I have to work as well so I hope it goes quickly and I can go home and rest. I may work from home tomorrow and take it easy. Good luck Evy! We are praying for you. Texas Karen, I am glad your DH got home safe and you get to spend time with him. Good luck with your tx tomorrow. Welcome MsFriz! Sorry you had to joing us here. I have TAC every 3 weeks for 6 tx as well. 2 down for me 4 to go. I hope those having tx coming up do well. Hard to keep track of them all. Take care, Penny
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Nov 29, 2007 03:09AM carpediempenny wrote: I don't know how you ladies do it. I have my 3rd tx tomorrow - TAC - and then the neulasta shot the day after. I hear a lot of you say you do so many weeks of 2 chemicals and then so many weeks of the last usually taxatore. I have all 3 at once and it sucks a big fat suck! It takes me a good 10 days to feel some what normal again. I spend so much time on the couch just laying there because I have no energy. Between that and being pissed because I have this and then crying because I can't do what I normally would be able to do. So I don't know which chemical is causing me the most grief. After my last tx my wonderful dh arranged for my mother in law and sister in laws to clean my new house for me so we could move in and when I went to see it (not knowing they had done it) I was just so pissy about it. Fortunately my dh was the only one there and I felt so bad about how I acted that I just cried. Anyway good luck Karyll, I hope all goes well. Hey Kara, I was just diagnosed with early onset graves disease and I am taking PTU for that. Too early for me to tell any difference yet. This week my eyes have been all gummy/runny as well. yuck, I didn't even think about old mascara and losing eye lashes. Thanks for the info. Take care ladies, I need to get some work done. Penny
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Dec 12, 2007 08:09AM carpediempenny wrote: Welcome Hate_It! It takes me a good 10 days to recoup from each tx. I have so many se that it wears on me until I break down and just cry. I can think about chemo and get nauseated. I am half way done with chemo and really don't want to do the other 3. Each tx scares me more and more. I think what bad stuff the adriamycin is doing to my body, heart and mind. I can't say any one se is worse for me as they all wear me down but if I had to chose it would be the fatigue. I can't sleep a whole night and that probably doesn't help. Hang in there and know that there are so many of us going through this. Thank you Lori for thinking of me. TO all Oct chemo ladies take care and I pray each of you have peaceful times through out all this crap.
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2007 07:34PM carpediempenny wrote: HI lorian, I had SNB done on 10/08/07. I didn't do the lumpectomy yet. I wanted to see if the chemo worked but I started chemo on 10/19/07. I would have started sooner but they ended up taking 27 lymph nodes and I had a drain tube that had to come out before I could start chemo, that took a week. I know I am confused as to what size my tumor actually is. My surgeon will take what she needs in order to get clear margins so it is was it is, unfortunately. They are estimating it is between 4 and 5 cm. I still have time to decide if I want more then just a lumpectomy. I will have the gene testing and that make help in my decision. Opie, I pray all goes well with you and your tx. Take care all, Penny

Posts.Content: Nov 14, 2007 12:30PM carpediempenny wrote: Congrats Evy! What a wonderful sweet little guy. He will have all kinds of stories to tell when he gets older. Msfriz6, always good to know someone else is on the same cocktail. My 2nd tx seemed better then my first tx. Of course the 1st time around (3 weeks leading up to 1st tx) I was hit with the dx, flu, MRI and all those tests, surgery, 2 periods and the flu shot and then my 1st tx. Plus the pidgeon that pooped on my head the 3rd day after my 1st tx. No wonder I didn't do so good. Also I just got the call today from the endo and she told me I have early graves disease. So I get to add another medication to my list now. Just 9 months ago I was complaining about taking a cholesterol medication, now look at me. My hope still is to come through this and feel like a whole new person. Of course I have to get the approval from the onc first before I take any new meds. I hope everyone having tx this week does well. We close on our new house today so we will be moving next weekend. Should be my good time right before #3. Take care ladies. You are in my thoughts and prayers. Penny

Posts.Content: May 23, 2008 06:23PM carpediempenny wrote: Hi, I did neoadjuvant chemo and there were days that I thought the tumor was growing. It is so hard to tell just feeling from the outside. The ultrasound measured smaller but I was still discouraged. It wasn't until after surgery and the test results came back that I felt more relieved that chemo had done it's job. The path results came back as the tumor was basically gone but just small speckles of cancer cells remained. It still felt huge from the outside to me. I had 6 round of TAC. I was glad to have done chemo first because that gave me time to think about my surgery options. I first wanted breast conservation and to go for a lumpectomy but ended up doing a bilateral mastectomy with immed recon. I am happy with my decision. Good luck and take care, Penny

Posts.Content: Oct 25, 2007 03:12PM carpediempenny wrote: Hi I am new to this board, first day actually. I was diagnosed 9/26/07 had all the tests done in 3 weeks, port put in on 10/08/07 along with the SNB. I have IDC grade 3, stage 2b. One of the two sentinal nodes was positive, the remaining 25 nodes removed were also negative for cancer. yay My first chemo was 10/19/07. I also went in to the hair place right after chemo and cut my hair off. I knew I wouldn't be able handle it falling out in clumps. I must say either it was the chemo or the neulasta shot that kicked my butt. All I have wanted to do is sleep for the last 6 days. Today I actually feel more human but have so many aches that I didn't have before chemo started. I got the sore throat which was no fun. That is finally getting better today, still a little raw. I am glad I found this board. I am looking forward to chatting with everyone and getting to know you. Thanks in advance for help and information. Penny
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2007 07:12AM carpediempenny wrote: Wow, so amazing everything we go through. I am finally feeling better and it's been 10 days since my first chemo. I go again on 11/09. Has anyones taste buds been changed by chemo and how long did it last. Everything tastes funny to me and even mustard feels like it burns my tongue. I am nervous for session #2 after being so tired from the first one. I didn't realize the back pains were from neulasta either. Alishar, you dh sounds like mine, he bought me two wigs and wants to go and get a couple more. This time different colors, I am normally blonde.  How many of you go out without any head coverings after your hair fall outs? Thanks, Penny

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2007 02:18AM carpediempenny wrote: Karen, I love your wig, you look beautiful! What is your normal hair color? I shaved my head the day of my first chemo treatment. Mine has thinned but not completely fallen out. I still have eyebrows and eyelashes but almost no pubic hair. Interesting how we all lose hair differently. 2nd chemo tx for me is this Friday. I go to the endocronologist today to see if there is something they can do for my thyroid. Sure would be nice to come out on the other side of all this next spring, have everything working correctly and feel like a new woman. I won't know what to do with myself.

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2008 06:48AM carpediempenny wrote: HI ladies - I hear you on this one. Unfortunately I am 6 months out of radiation and I still have the swelling in hands, feet and upper arms. I do know from the doctors my heart came through the chemo drugs doing good and that I don't have lymphadema. SO for me I guess it is just going to take time. NOt really what I want to hear. They did put me on a blood pressure medicine with a water pill in it but that doesn't really seem to help. I am getting really discouraged. Penny
Posts.Title: swollen hands and achey body mamakaren linda05

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2008 02:11PM carpediempenny wrote: Hi Deanna, I've been to a lymphadema PT twice and she has confirmed that I don't have it. She thinks it is also odd that I have swelling in both arms, in fact the left is more swollen then the right and it was the right side that had the lymph nodes removed. I know this is temporary, at least I am hoping it is. I will do what I can and that is eat right and exercise. I'll keep going to the doctors until they find something. I am just tired of seeing doctors. I haven't had more then a week since this all started that I haven't had a doctor visit of some kind. Oh well, I haven't given up yet. I was diagnosed with osteopenia so maybe that explains the bone pain at least, but not the swelling. Thanks for your kind thougths ladies. Penny
